item.title: Example Talk
item.description:
Note
Click on the Slides button above to view the built-in slides feature.

Slides can be added in a few ways:

  • Create slides using Hugo Blox Builder’s feature and link using slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file
  • Upload an existing slide deck to static/ and link using url_slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file
  • Embed your slides (e.g. Google Slides) or presentation video on this page using .

Further event details, including such as image galleries, can be added to the body of this page.

item.title: Enhancing Clustering Stability, Compactness, and Separation in Multimodal Data Environments
item.description:
Note
Click the Cite button above to demo the feature to enable visitors to import publication metadata into their reference management software.
Note
Create your slides in Markdown - click the Slides button to check out the example.

Add the publication’s full text or supplementary notes here. You can use rich formatting such as including .

item.title: XX WESAAC: An Invitation to Share, Learn, and Build Together
item.description:
I am pleased to announce the XX edition of the Workshop-School on Agents, Environments, and Applications (WESAAC), for which I have the honor of serving as General Chair. WESAAC holds a special place in the Brazilian agents community, and this new edition continues its tradition as both a scientific forum and a formative space for researchers at different stages of their academic journey. .

WESAAC was conceived as more than a conventional workshop. It is also an environment designed to encourage learning, dialogue, and collaboration. Over the years, it has brought together undergraduate students, M.Sc. and Ph.D. candidates, and senior researchers, creating a unique setting where early ideas are welcomed, ongoing projects are refined, and mature research is openly discussed. The program will combine short courses led by experienced researchers with technical sessions featuring full papers, short papers, and demo sessions.

As General Chair, one of my main goals for this edition is to reinforce WESAAC as a space where research-in-progress is valued as much as finalized results. I strongly encourage submissions that reflect different stages of academic work—whether exploratory, theoretical, applied, or interdisciplinary. Sharing challenges, partial results, and lessons learned is essential to building a strong, connected research community.

The XX WESAAC will take place alongside the in Cuiabá, MT, Brazil, in October 2026, offering participants the opportunity to engage not only with the agent community but also with the broader intelligent systems ecosystem, reinforcing WESAAC’s role as a key national forum for multi-agent systems research.

If you are working on autonomous agents, multi-agent systems, learning and coordination mechanisms, agent-based simulation, LLM agents, or real-world applications of agent technologies, I warmly invite you to submit your article. Further information on the important dates will be provided as appropriate. Whether this is your first academic contribution or part of a long-term research agenda, WESAAC is a place to exchange ideas, receive constructive feedback, connect with peers who share a passion for agent-based systems, and engage in meaningful discussions.

I look forward to welcoming you to this edition of WESAAC and to the conversations, ideas, and collaborations that will emerge from it.

item.title: Awards
item.description:
2025

  • Honorable mention to Best Ph.D. Thesis Award at the Concourse of Thesis and Dissertations (Student André Regino) at the XXXI Brazilian Symposium on Multimedia and Web (WebMedia’25)

  • Best Paper Award, 17th International Conference on Knowledge Engineering and Ontology Development (KEOD/IC3K 2025).

  • Best Paper Award at the XIX Workshop-School on Agents, Environments, and Applications (WESAAC’25).

2024

  • Best Paper Contender at the 29th International Conference on Natural Language & Information Systems (NLDB’24)

  • Best Paper Award at the VIII Workshop de Computação Urbana (CoUrb’24) of the 42º Simpósio Brasileiro de Redes de Computadores e Sistemas Distribuídos

2023

  • Best Student Paper Award Nominee at the 15th International Joint Conference on Knowledge Engineering and Ontology Development (KEOD’23)

  • Best Paper Candidate at the 15th International Joint Conference on Knowledge Engineering and Ontology Development (KEOD’23)

  • Best Paper Award at the 25th International Conference on Human-Computer Interaction (HCII’23)

2022

  • 3rd Best Master Dissertation at the Concourse of Thesis and Dissertations (Student André Regino) at the XXVIII Brazilian Symposium on Multimedia and Web (WebMedia’22)

  • Best Student Paper Award at the 14th International Conference on Knowledge Engineering and Ontology Development (KEOD’22)

  • Best Paper Award at the 24th International Conference on Enterprise Information Systems (ICEIS’22)

2021

  • Paper Honorable Mention Award at the XV Brazilian e-Science Workshop (BreSci) collocated with the XLI Brazilian Computer Society Congress 2021, Brazil

2020

  • Best paper presentation at the 6th Natural Language Interfaces for the Web of Data (NLIWOD) Workshop at the ISWC 2020

  • Best Paper Nominee at the XVII Brazilian Congress in Health Informatics 2020, Brazil

  • Best Master Thesis proposal at the XIII Seminar on Ontology Research in Brazil - IV Doctoral and Masters Consortium on Ontologies (Student André Gomes Regino), Brazil

  • Best Paper Nominee at the 22nd International Conference on Enterprise Information Systems 2020, Czech Republic

2016

  • Best Paper Award in the IEEE International Conference WETICE 2016, France

  • Best 2016 Ph.D. Thesis Award given by the International Association for Research in Knowledge Extraction and Management (EGC), France

2015

  • Finalist in the 2015 Cor Baayen Award sponsored by the ERCIM (European Research Consortium for Informatics and Mathematics) for grace promising young researchers in Computer Science

  • Best Short Paper Award at the XXX Brazilian Symposium on Databases (SBBD), Brazil

  • 2nd Project Prize Award at the 3rd Extended Semantic Web Summer School, Greece

2011

  • Best 2011 M.Sc. Thesis Award by the Institute of Computing at the University of Campinas, Brazil

  • M.Sc. Thesis finalist at the 2011 Concourse of Thesis promoted by the Brazilian Computer Society, Brazil

  • Best Paper Award at the International Conference on Information Society in 2011, United Kingdom

item.title: Pandas
item.description: Flexible and powerful data analysis / manipulation library for Python, providing labeled data structures.

item.title: PyTorch
item.description: PyTorch is a Python package that provides tensor computation (like NumPy) with strong GPU acceleration.

item.title: scikit-learn
item.description: scikit-learn is a Python module for machine learning built on top of SciPy and is distributed under the 3-Clause BSD license.
